answers.answer: Well lets see.....Christmas was fun but hectic we were back and forth between my fams and my in laws house. This week is all about getting ready for the baby shower on 1/18. Logan's room was painted yesterday and his border is going up in the next day or so. We have finished clearing out his room except for his things (wardrobe, changing table so far). For New Years i am going to a get together at my moms which should be fun.Moving around is definitely getting harder. I find myself getting stuck sittin/laying often. Sleep is still brutal between having to be every 2 hrs and not being able to stay comfortable its tough. So far no swelling. But having some numbness in my hands during bed time. Sciatica had begun to act up in my right leg which makes my movements even worse....My next Dr appt is tomorrow morning. I plan on finding out if Logan is working his way into position. Plus i am curious if they can guesstimate his weight. Only 6ish weeks left for me so far.Hope everyone is doing well.Happy New Year

Hmmmm....lots of dramas for me in the past week.I'm currently in Hong Kong, staying with my colleague and his family (wife, 3 kids and father).  One can still travel up to 36 weeks and I guess I'm making the most of it.I went with them to China and we did a 4 day, 3 night package tour to Xian, just back on Monday late.  It was very interesting and very hectic and I got to do lots of walking. Saw the terracotta warriors, many temples, famous writings, among others...... got heaps of photos and I'll try to post a few in a while.....It was also freezing cold, but no snow.  My first time to experience such cold weather.  The hardest thing was that my **** went rock hard from the cold and were exquisitely painful in a way I have never experienced before!  Hope breast feeding aint going to feel anything like that when I first start.I'm on insulin.  On the last day, I took my insulin, finished packing and headed down for breakfast.  I never made it to the breakfast area.  I collapsed in the lobby.  I was still talking, but have no recollection of the next hour or so.  My colleague was called and told them my history.  They tried to test my blood sugar and it was not detectable on their instrument.... so they were giving me sugar water and candy.  My colleague says I was talking to them and disagreeing with their instructions, but I have no memory of that.  The hotel called an ambulance and I was taken to the hospital.  I 'woke up' at the hospital.  They did ultrasound to check the baby, urinalysis and a few other tests. All in Chinese (I understand a bit of chinese, but my colleague was also translating for me).   All tests were ok, except the urinalysis which showed protein (+1) and keytones (first time to see protein, and I test every few weeks.  And first time to test for keytones).So I'll have to follow up on that when I get back to Manila in a couple of days (I sent a message to my endocrinologist, but guess he's on holiday and no response so far) - due to head back on Saturday.  My BP is rising compared to normal (previously it was very low), but is still within normal range....   so I reckon they're going to be monitoring me for preeclampsia very closely now.I'm packed for the hospital...... already..... in case.....Having back pain the past 2 days, worse today.  Baby's moving a lot too.  Not at all helped by my having a nasty cold and asthma at the moment, and the meds aren't working so well.  My tummy is sore from coughing.This Friday I'll be 35 weeks.  Baby's got to hang on another 2 weeks up to 37 weeks, at least.  My next Drs apt is on 5th.  We'll also be doing ultrasound to check baby's position, size, and all.  So I'll also have an update for the next post.Best wishes to all.  Not so long for us now.Happy New Year everyone.

Well, if you have read my recent post..you will know that I am offically pulled from work and on bedrest to keep this baby in until I hit 36 weeks. Only 2 more weeks til I am there! Im just trying to take it easy and not do too much to want her to come out early!

I love reading all the updates!!!  :)Well, my booty feels like its separating from the left side of my lower back.  :P  haha.  All kinds of wonderful things that go along with that.  I feel like a little (fat) old lady that has to hunch over when first standing up, then I can slowly straighten my back but not w/o little niggly pains.I have my 32 week appointment on Monday (I'll be 32 weeks Friday).  I am so excited about that.  :)  I love hearing Daniel's hb and just knowing how they think he is.He is very fond of pushing his little butt up into the right side of my ribcage.  That is the side he seems to have favored this whole pregnancy.  I love feeling him shift around also.Sleeping is become a little more challenging, as hubby is snoring b/c of a cold.  I would love to go and try to sleep on our couch propped up, but he gets very sad when I leave him at night.  :P  and comes out to the living room and looks for me.  I feel bad about that, but am probley going to have to put my foot down and say "let me expirement a little" for the sake of my back.  I usually wake up with a backache...any one else????Hubby bought me a super nice boppy pregnancy pillow for Christmas!!!  :)  I love it!  i think it will make the last few weeks a bit easier when I have to lay down.

well hey there  ladies  frist i hope all of u have a happy new year eve lol it is snowing where i am not like i was  going out  anyway lol i am  stuck  at work :(well had my 31-32 wk checkup yesterday along with the u/s Mckenna is perfect they  couldnt get  any good pics of her face  but we  did the  3d u/s so , she refused to move when they  wanted  her to and even looked like she  swatted her hand at them when they tried . they have  her  weighing close to  5 lbs already  and i still 7 or so weeks to  go yikes huh  lookslike  another  big baby  for me.Now how i am  feeling  again like  last time i  done with  being preggo, i am having  horrible  lower back and  hip  everytime i  get up and try to move she  has moved  down a little cause the heart burn has gone away for  now  so that is making life a little easier  harder  for the walking around and sleeping but i am  still managing ot sleep in the bed  but  i am thinkin  with the next week or two i will be  on couch  and resting as for work  i am still  going butbarely  they have me on redusced  schedule down to  32 hours for now  and that is going down  as i get closer  Dr  is thinking about  inducing me earlier  due to her size  already   but  we are going to  discuss that at the next visitagain to all the ladies  have  good new years holiday  and  pretty  soon we are  going to have little onesttyljesselynn

Happy New Year!!  2009, can you believe it??  time flies...Well, lets see...we had a quiet christmas here at home, all of our family is either is Dallas or NY/NJ, and we live in Va....so no family, well just us...hubby and son.  It was really nice though.We have been getting things done around the house as well, which has been nice, we are both off until Monday!!  i am a super clean freak and organizer...so I want to make sure everything is clean before the baby gets here..i have been cleaning baseboards, celing fans, the refridgerator out...you name it!!I have been feeling about the same as everyone else, very restless!!  It is very hard to sleep at night, my hips are hurting the worse, I have to constantly flop over....still getting up to pee every 2-3 hours or so!!  Feel like I am waddling everywhere, my maternity clothes don't even seem to fit, and it hurts when Nathan moves around a lot.  I still have not dropped completely yet, beely is still way up there...but he feels huge....I can feel when he moves from my cervix all the way up to my stomach and ribs!!I am ready, 36 weeks tomorrow!!  1-4 more weeks...as long as he is healthy...i will take next weekend!! ;)

SARgirl, we are due the same time! I will be 36 weeks tomorrow too! It is comforting to know I'm so close to delivering...I haven't been feeling that bad but some days and nights are tough. And most of all, I spend so much time in Caidens room, just going through his clothes and it just makes me want him here that much more! But I am like you..especially now that were in a new home, I try and keep everything perfect and clean! I'm not sure if its extra anal because I'm Pregnant but I am always cleaning or organizing something.I'm not waddling yet but if I'm sitting for long periods of time and get up my hip cracks and my legs get soo stiff. But its not too long now!We had a nice New Years...had some friends over, stayed up WAY too late and only got 5 hours of sleep so I am soo tired! But it was so much fun and it was weird, when they left..I was like OMG the next time I see you all we will have a baby!! It was just so surreal. Hope everyone had a nice New Years!!

question: Wow ladies, I can't believe ANOTHER week has already passed!! So how is everyone feeling this week? Any changes? Everyone have a nice Christmas? Any plans for New Years??Right after I posted last weeks Check-In my body started to change immediately! Within this past week, sleeping has gotten more difficult for me. I think most of it had to do with the fact I had a small cold and couldn't breath too well out of my nose. BUT I was finding it very difficult to get comfortable laying down and thats never happened to me! I would just lay there and know I'm not comfortable...but couldn't pin point why! So for 2 nights in a row I slept sitting up. I told my mom that and she said when she was Pregnant with my brother, for the last month she was only comfy sleeping sitting up. But the past few nights I have been falling asleep laying down and I've been fine. So I dont know if its the way he's positioned or what. But I've been getting up to pee almost every single hour! My doctor said once his head turns down the pressure to pee will be more often and more painful...so it must be that time! Rolling over or getting up and down is funny...sometimes I need a push from hubby! LOLSitting up and watching TV for long periods of time makes me super uncomfortable too. Caiden gets in this position where it feels like he is completely spread out...and there's really no where for him to go anymore so it just feels like my stomach is in a big knot! So I have to get up and move around frequently. I shouldn't complain though, I guess this is all mild stuff..could be worse! But the more days that pass, the more ready I am to meet my little boy!Our Christmas was fun but busy! We traveled to my husbands family and than had a Holiday Party at our house to see my family and my husbands together. New Years were having a small get together with friends here so that ought to be fun!And lastly my next Doctors Appointment is Jan 5th!! So I'll have an update on next weeks check in! Hope you're all feeling great, can't wait to hear from you!!
title: December 30th Weekly Check-In!
